oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Union Cpl. Jesse M. Pirkle
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This letter was written by Cpl. Jesse M. Pirkle, Co. G, 3rd Tenn. Cav., USA to Miss Susan E. Slamper. Pirkle describes a scouting mission in search of the forces of Confederate Gen. Joseph Wheeler including the fact that his company captain and bugler were captured. Pirkle was captured at Sulphur Branch Trestle, Alabama on September 25, 1864 and confined at Andersonville Prison Camp. He survived to be discharged from the US Army in May 1865 at Camp Chase, Ohio.
